name: Kepler-670
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-670 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-670 is a star with 0.99 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.99 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.79 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-670 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-670 system


Kepler-670 b

Kepler-670 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of Kepler-670 b is 13.18 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-670, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
